Label: AC Frequency
Comment: AC frequency is the number of cycles per second in an alternating current (AC) sine wave.

Label: AC Meausrement
Comment: The Data Model intended to measure the electrical energies consumed by an electrical system which uses an Alternating Current (AC) for a three-phase (L1, L2, L3) or single-phase (L) and neutral (N). It integrates the initial version of the data Modem [THREEPHASEMEASUREMENT], extended to also perform single-phase measurements. It includes attributes for various electrical measurements such as power, frequency, current and voltage.

Label: Ability
Comment: Possession of the means or skill to do something (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Active Fire Protection Device
Comment: It is an integral part of the fire protection used as a first response to minimize the spread of fire and related effects.

Label: Activity
Comment: A process that a person, group of persons, or machine does during a specific amount of time, such as visiting, shopping, etc.

Label: Activity Impact
Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an activity on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

Label: Activity Severity
Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an activity for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

Label: Activity Status
Comment: It expresses the status of a specific activity being performed by a person.

Label: Actuating function
Comment: A function that allows to transmit data to actuators, such as level settings (e.g., temperature) or binary switching (e.g., open/close, on/off)

Label: Actuator
Comment: A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system

Label: Actuator
Comment: A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system by performing an actuating function

Label: Actuator
Comment: An actuator is a mechanical device for moving or controlling a mechanism or system. An actuator takes energy, usually created by air, electricity, or liquid, and converts that into some kind of motion.

Label: Air Conditioner
Comment: A machine that keeps the air in a building cool.

Label: Air to air heat recovery
Comment: An air-to-air heat recovery device employs a counter-flow heat exchanger between inbound and outbound air flow. It is typically used to transfer heat from warmer air in one chamber to cooler air in the second chamber (i.e., typically used to recover heat from the conditioned air being exhausted and the outside air being supplied to a building), resulting in energy savings from reduced heating (or cooling) requirements.

Label: Alarm
Comment:
An alarm is a device that signals the existence of a condition or situation that is outside the boundaries of normal expectation or that activates such a device.

Alarms include the provision of break glass buttons and manual pull boxes that are used to activate alarms.

Label: Alarm
Comment: A warning of danger or potential undesired situation.

Label: Alerting Device
Comment: Alerting devices are those devices that are used to react to normal as well as alarming situations to let people know that some specific condition is occuring.

Label: Alerting Device For Impaired Person
Comment: An alerting device that is used to assist or notify people with impairments during a specific circumstance.

Label: Alzheimer's Diseased Person
Comment: A person having an Alzheimer's disease.

Label: Apartment
Comment: A suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartment house (Cambridge English Dictionary).

Label: Appartment Building
Comment: A set of one or more buildings that contain apartments in it.

Label: Appliance
Comment: The household appliance that consumes energy, such as fridge, oven, TV, etc.

Label: Area
Comment: Specifies the area of the building.

Label: Assembly Building
Comment: places used for people gathering for entertainment, worship, and eating or drinking. Examples: churches, restaurants.

Label: Assembly Point
Comment: A place where people in an office, etc. should go if there is an emergency, for example, a fire (Cambridge English Dictionary) .

Label: Assumption
Comment: The assumption of the methematical model of KPI calculation

Label: Attic
Comment: the part of a building, especially of a house, directly under a roof; garret.

Label: Audio Description
Comment: A type of description in which sounds such as voices, are used to provide the information about any entity.

Label: Audio visual appliance
Comment:
An audio-visual appliance is a device that displays, captures, transmits, or receives audio or video.

Audio-visual appliances may be fixed in place or may be able to be moved from one space to another. They may require an electrical supply that may be supplied either by an electrical circuit or provided from a local battery source. Audio-visual appliances may be connected to data circuits including specialist circuits for audio visual purposes only.

Label: Autonomous Mobility Person
Comment: A person who can walk on his/her with a help of a non-motorised device, e.g. crutches.

Label: Availability Status
Comment: It expresses the status of something that is either available or not.

Label: Balcony
Comment: An accessible structure extending from a building, especially outside a window.

Label: Basement
Comment: A story of a building, partly or wholly underground.

Label: Bathroom
Comment: Bathroom is mainly used for bathing & washing up related activities.

Label: Battery
Comment: The set of batteries that stores energy.

Label: Bedroom
Comment: Bedroom is used mainly for sleeping.

Label: Blind Person
Comment: A person who has lost the vision completly and can neither see naturally nor with the help of any device.

Label: Boiler
Comment: A device that heats water, especially to provide heating and hot water in a house.

Label: Boiler
Comment: A boiler is a closed, pressure-rated vessel in which water or other fluid is heated using an energy source such as natural gas, heating oil, or electricity. The fluid in the vessel is then circulated out of the boiler for use in various processes or heating applications.

Label: Building
Comment: Buildings are roofed constructions which can be used separately, have been built for permanent purposes, can be entered by persons and are suitable or intended for protecting persons, animals or objects.

Label: Building
Comment: A category that includes devices as described by building related data models, such as IFC and FIEMSER

Label: Building
Comment: The building in the district.

Label: Building
Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

Label: Building Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a building.

Label: Building Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a building.

Label: Building Space
Comment: A Space is a 3D volume bounded by surfaces. It represents the physical spaces of the building.

Label: Building Spatial Structure
Comment: A man made structure with spatial properties.

Label: Building Storey
Comment: The storey represents a (nearly) horizontal aggregation of spaces that are vertically bound.

Label: Building device
Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in a building.

Label: Building object
Comment: An object in the building that can be controlled by devices, such as a door or a window that can be automatically opened or closed by an actuator.  (Definition taken from SAREF 1.0)

Label: Building related
Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

Label: Building space
Comment: An entity used to define the physical spaces of the building. A building space contains devices or building objects.

Label: BuildingElement
Comment: The element composes the building structure.

Label: BuildingEquipment
Comment: The equipment contained in building

Label: BuildingParameter
Comment: The building static parameter that to be measured, like area, volume, material property

Label: BuildingStorey
Comment: Building storey captures the storey structure in building

Label: BuildingThing
Comment: All things (here physical objects) that creates a building, it is intended as root of all building components.

Label: BuildingType
Comment: Building type describes the functinonal type of a building

Label: Burner
Comment: A burner is a device that converts fuel into heat through combustion. It includes gas, oil, and wood burners.

Label: Business Building
Comment: Places where services are provided. Examples: banks, insurance agencies.

Label: CO2 level
Comment: A property related to measurements of CO2 level in the air. Measured in ppm.

Label: Chemical Spill
Comment: A hazardous event that happens due to the spillage or leakge of any toxic chemical in the building.

Label: Chiller
Comment: A chiller is a device used to remove heat from a liquid via a vapor-compression or absorption refrigeration cycle to cool a fluid, typically water or a mixture of water and glycol. The chilled fluid is then used to cool and dehumidify air in a building.

Label: Cinema Building
Comment: A building in which movies are shown.

Label: Classroom
Comment: A room, typically in a school, in which a class of students is taught (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Close command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Close state
Comment: The state of a device that is CLOSE

Label: Coal
Comment: A type of commodity

Label: Coil
Comment:
A coil is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media. A common example is a cooling coil, which utilizes a finned coil in which circulates chilled water, antifreeze, or refrigerant that is used to remove heat from air moving across the surface of the coil. A coil may be used either for heating or cooling purposes by placing a series of tubes (the coil) carrying a heating or cooling fluid into an airstream. The coil may be constructed from tubes bundled in a serpentine form or from finned tubes that give a extended heat transfer surface.

Coils may also be used for non-airflow cases such as embedded in a floor slab.

Label: Colour Blind Person
Comment: A person having the decreased ability to see color or differences in color.

Label: Command
Comment: A directive that a device must support to perform a certain function. A command may act upon a state, but does not necessarily act upon a state. For example, the ON command acts upon the ON/OFF state, but the GET command does not act upon any state, it simply gives a directive to retrieve a certain value. We propose here a list of commands that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: Commodity
Comment: A marketable item for which there is demand, but which is supplied without qualitative differentiation across a market. SAREF refers to energy commodities such as electricity, gas, coal and oil.

Label: Common Area
Comment: Amenities such as corridors, hallways, lobby, pool, toilets provided for the comfort and use of all occupants, owners, tenants, or users of a building or building complex.

Label: Communication appliance
Comment:
A communications appliance transmits and receives electronic or digital information as data or sound.

Communication appliances may be fixed in place or may be able to be moved from one space to another. Communication appliances require an electrical supply that may be supplied either by an electrical circuit or provided from a local battery source.

Label: Compressor
Comment: A compressor is a device that compresses a fluid typically used in a refrigeration circuit.

Label: Condenser
Comment: A condenser is a device that is used to dissipate heat, typically by condensing a substance such as a refrigerant from its gaseous to its liquid state.

Label: Congestion
Comment: An event that happens at bottlenecks when the flow of people increases than a provided limit due to herding (and similar phenomena of human behaviour), especially during an emergency evacuation process.

Label: Controller
Comment:
A controller is a device that monitors inputs and controls outputs within a building automation system.

A controller may be physical (having placement within a spatial structure) or logical (a software interface or aggregated within a programmable physical controller).

Label: Cooled beam
Comment: A cooled beam (or chilled beam) is a device typically used to cool air by circulating a fluid such as chilled water through exposed finned tubes above a space. Typically mounted overhead near or within a ceiling, the cooled beam uses convection to cool the space below it by acting as a heat sink for the naturally rising warm air of the space. Once cooled, the air naturally drops back to the floor where the cycle begins again.

Label: Cooling tower
Comment: A cooling tower is a device which rejects heat to ambient air by circulating a fluid such as water through it to reduce its temperature by partial evaporation.

Label: Corridor
Comment: A gallery or passage connecting parts of a building; hallway.

Label: Corridor Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a corridor.

Label: Corridor Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a corridor.

Label: Corridor Segment
Comment: A fragment or an atomic element of a corridor.

Label: Currency unit
Comment: The unit of measure for price

Label: Current
Comment: The movement of electricity in a particular direction.

Label: Current
Comment: A property related to measurements measured in Ampere (A).

Label: DHWSystem
Comment: The domestic hot water system that provides hot water to the building

Label: Damper
Comment: A damper typically participates in an HVAC duct distribution system and is used to control or modulate the flow of air.

Label: DatumSource
Comment: Datum source needed for KPI calculation

Label: Day Care
Comment: A place where infants and young children are provided a supervision and care of during the daytime, particularly so that their parents can hold jobs.

Label: Day Type
Comment: Represents the type of weather for a given location (e.g. sunny, cloudy,...).

Label: Description
Comment: A representation and detail of a person, object, or event. It is used to describe the details of anything.

Label: Deviation State
Comment: It models the user's deviation state from one's proposed route. For example, NoDeviate, RareDeviate, OftenDeviate, and TooOftenDeviate.

Label: Device
Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function.

Label: Device
Comment: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Device
Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs a start and stop function. Devices can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect the different domain in which a device is used, e.g., smart appliances domain (subclass FunctionRelated) vs. building domain (subclass BuildingRelated) vs. smart grid domain (subclass EnergyRelated). New categories can be defined,if needed, to reflect other differences, for example different points of view, such as the point of view of the device's user vs. the point of view of the device's manufacturer. We propose a list of devices that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: Dining Room
Comment: A room in which meals are eaten, as in a home or hotel, especially the room in which the major or more formal meals are eaten.

Label: Dishwasher
Comment: A machine for washing dishes.

Label: Display Screen
Comment: A display screen is an output device to represent the information in visual or tactile form.

Label: Distance
Comment: The Distance between two points, nodes or spaces.

Label: DistributedEnergyResources
Comment: Distributed energy resource is the site energy resource in district like CHP (Combined Heat and Power), photovoltaic generation plant, etc.

Label: Distribution control device
Comment: Represents devices of a building automation control system that are used to impart control over elements of a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributioncontrolelement.htm)

Label: Distribution device
Comment: Generalization of all devices that participate in a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcproductextension/lexical/ifcdistributionelement.htm)

Label: DistributionFlowDevice
Comment: Represents devices of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributionflowelement.htm)

Label: District
Comment: District is the platform where contains multi buildings and other physical objects.

Label: Domestic Cold Water Consumption
Comment: The amount of domestic cold water consumed.

Label: Domestic Hot Water Consumption
Comment: The amount of domestic hot water consumed.

Label: Door
Comment: the large flat piece of wood, glass etc that you move when you go into or out of a building, room, vehicle etc, or when you open a cupboard (Longman Dictionary of Contemporary English Online)

Label: Door switch
Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Safety, performs the saref:OpenCloseFunction, is used for controlling a door, and can be found in the state saref:OpenCloseState.

Label: Down Syndrome Person
Comment: A person with Down's syndrome.

Label: Duct
Comment: The duct in HVAC system

Label: Duct silencer
Comment: A duct silencer is a device that is typically installed inside a duct distribution system for the purpose of reducing the noise levels from air movement, fan noise, etc. in the adjacent space or downstream of the duct silencer device.

Label: Dwelling
Comment: Place where a person or group of people live.

Label: Earthquake
Comment: A sudden violent shaking of the ground, typically causing great destruction, as a result of movements within the earth's crust or volcanic action (Oxford Dictionary of English). It may cause a sudden panic among the occupants of the building.

Label: Educational Building
Comment: Schools and day care centers.

Label: Electric appliance
Comment:
An electric appliance is a device intended for consumer usage that is powered by electricity.

Electric appliances may be fixed in place or may be able to be moved from one space to another. Electric appliances require an electrical supply that may be supplied either by an electrical circuit or provided from a local battery source.

Label: Electric flow storage device
Comment: An electric flow storage device is a device in which electrical energy is stored and from which energy may be progressively released.

Label: Electric generator
Comment: An electric generator is an engine that is a machine for converting mechanical energy into electrical energy.

Label: Electric motor
Comment: An electric motor is an engine that is a machine for converting electrical energy into mechanical energy.

Label: Electric time control
Comment: An electric time control is a device that applies control to the provision or flow of electrical energy over time.

Label: ElectricVehicle
Comment: Electric vehicle that stores energy.

Label: Electricity
Comment: A type of commodity

Label: Elevator
Comment: Elevator is used to transport people between different floors.

Label: Emergency Activity
Comment: An activity that is done with an urgency and highest priority.

Label: Emergency Evacuation
Comment: It represents an immediate escape of people away from a particular area that has ongoing or imminent hazard to their lives or property.

Label: Emergency Evacuation Group
Comment: A group of two or more persons who are supposed to evacuate the building together.

Label: Emergency Evacuation Route
Comment: A type of route in which only those spaces are mentioned that are potentially safe for its users as well as the ending point of it must be an exit from a particular space.

Label: Emergency Exit
Comment: Emergency exit is logical point that is only used in case of any emergency conditions such as fire, etc.

Label: End Point
Comment: A logic point that is used to indicate the end of a corridor.

Label: Energy Consumption
Comment: The amount of energy consumed.

Label: Energy conversion device
Comment: The distribution flow element EnergyConversionDevice defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

Label: Energy meter
Comment: An energy meter is a device of category saref:Meter that consists of a meter, accomplishes the tasks saref:MeterReading and saref:EnergyEfficiency, performs the saref:MeteringFunction and is used for the purpose of measuring the saref:Energy property

Label: Energy unit
Comment: The unit of measure for energy

Label: EnergyCost
Comment: The cost for purchasing energy from external grid

Label: EnergyCostTariff
Comment: The tariff for purchasing energy per unit from main grid (district energy provider)

Label: EnergyDemand
Comment: The energy demand in district or buildings

Label: EnergyFacility
Comment: The energy facility in building that consumes or produces energy

Label: EnergyForecast
Comment: The forecast of energy demand or production

Label: EnergyGain
Comment: The energy gain is the produced energy that feed into external grid so as to obtain monetary gain

Label: EnergyParameter
Comment: Energy parameter describes energy behavior in district and buildings, inluding energy production, energy storage, energy supply, energy demand, energy cost and tariff, etc.

Label: EnergyProduction
Comment: Energy producted by generation system

Label: EnergyStorage
Comment: The energy stored by storage system

Label: EnergySupply
Comment: The energy supplied to end uses

Label: EnergySupplyFromEnergyProvider
Comment: The energy supplied by district energy provider for end uses

Label: EnergySupplyFromSiteProduction
Comment: The energy supplied directly by site production for end uses

Label: EnergySupplyFromStorage
Comment: The energy supplied by storage system for end uses

Label: EnergyTariff
Comment: Tariff that is charged per energy unit by district energy providers

Label: EnergyType
Comment: The energy type produced, consumed, stored or provided, such as electricity, heat and cold

Label: Engine
Comment: An engine is a device that converts fuel into mechanical energy through combustion.

Label: EntityType
Comment: Entity type describes the type of a entity like building, equipment, energy, etc.

Label: Entrance
Comment: Entrance represents a space or a door that is used to enter into a building. Normally, it is also used as an exit.

Label: EnvironmentalParameter
Comment: The parameter describes the environment condition, including indoor environment (indoor comfort) and outdoor environment (weather)

Label: Equation
Comment: The equation of the mathematical model for KPI calculation

Label: Equipment
Comment: The equipment in building and district power system.

Label: EquipmentContainer
Comment: Equipment container is the district power unit that contains groups of equipment, like substation, plant, Distributed Energy Resources, etc.

Label: EquipmentParameter
Comment: The parameters of power equipment or building equipment.

Label: EquipmentType
Comment: Equipment type describes the type of an equipment

Label: Escalator
Comment: A moving staircase consisting of an endlessly circulating belt of steps driven by a motor, which conveys people between the floors of a public building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Escort Supported Wheelchair Person
Comment: A physical impaired person whose wheelchair is escorted by another person.

Label: Evaporative cooler
Comment: An evaporative cooler is a device that cools air by saturating it with water vapor.

Label: Evaporator
Comment: An evaporator is a device in which a liquid refrigerent is vaporized and absorbs heat from the surrounding fluid.

Label: Event
Comment: The event taken place in the zone, such entertainment event, dinner, conference, etc. A non-persistent, time-based occurrence, has location, duration, and responsible actors associated with an event.

Label: Event
Comment: An occurrence; something that happens (Oxford Dictionary of English). It represents when something planned or sudden happens.

Label: Event Impact
Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an event on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

Label: Event Severity
Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an event for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

Label: Event function
Comment: A function that allows to notify another device that a certain threshold value has been exceeded.

Label: Exit
Comment: Exit represents a logical representation for escaping or releasing from a specific phsyical space. Generally, an exit is as same as an entrance.

Label: Exit Route
Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the exit of a specific space.

Label: ExteriorWall
Comment: The exterior wall that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

Label: ExteriorWindow
Comment: The exterior window that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

Label: Family
Comment: A group of two or more persons having family ties between them.

Label: Fan
Comment: A fan is a device which imparts mechanical work on a gas. A typical usage of a fan is to induce airflow in a building services air distribution system.

Label: Fan
Comment: The fan in HVAC system

Label: FeatureOfInterest
Comment: A feature is an abstraction of real world phenomena (thing, person, event, etc)

Label: FeedInTariff
Comment: The tariff for sale energy per unit to main grid

Label: Filter
Comment: A filter is an apparatus used to remove particulate or gaseous matter from fluids and gases.

Label: Fire
Comment: An event that may burn different parts of the building and hazourdous for both the people and the building.

Label: Fire Door
Comment: A type of door used to minimize the spread of fire and related effects by isolating two connected spaces or sections in the building.

Label: Fire Escape Ladder
Comment: A type of ladder which is used to make an emergency exit through the window out of fire accident site.

Label: Fire Extinguisher
Comment: An active fire protection instrument used by persons to blow out small scale fire.

Label: Fire Protection Device
Comment: Device that is used to minimize the effects of potentially danger fires.

Label: Fire suppression terminal
Comment:
A fire suppression terminal has the purpose of delivering a fluid (gas or liquid) that will suppress a fire.

A fire suppression terminal provides for all forms of sprinkler, spreader and other form of terminal that is connected to a pipework system and intended to act in the role of suppressing a fire.

Label: Fitness Status
Comment: A fitness status is associated with a person that represent the quality of being suitable for a specific activity.

Label: Floor
Comment: The floor of the zone

Label: Floor Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a floor.

Label: Floor Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a specific floor and that leads to different floors of a building.

Label: Flow
Comment: A property related to measurements of rates of flow, measured in m³/s. This may for instance be used to measure air flow in ventilation or water flow in district heating systems.

Label: Flow controller
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowController defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.

Label: Flow instrument
Comment:
A flow instrument reads and displays the value of a particular property of a system at a point, or displays the difference in the value of a property between two points.

Instrumentation is typically for the purpose of determining the value of the property at a point in time. It is not the purpose of an instrument to record or integrate the values over time (although they may be connected to recording devices that do perform such a function). This entity provides for all forms of mechanical flow instrument (thermometers, pressure gauges etc.) and electrical flow instruments (ammeters, voltmeters etc.)

Label: Flow meter
Comment: A flow meter is a device that is used to measure the flow rate in a system.

Label: Flow moving device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowMovingDevice defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

Label: Flow storage device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowStorageDevice defines the occurrence of a device that participates in a distribution system and is used for temporary storage (such as a tank).

Label: Flow terminal
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTerminal defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.

Label: Flow treatment device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTreatmentDevice defines the occurrence of a device typically used to remove unwanted matter from a fluid, either liquid or gas, and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

Label: Footpath
Comment: A path for pedestrians in a built-up area; a pavement.

Label: Function
Comment: The functionality necessary to accomplish the task for which a Device is designed. A device can be designed to perform more than one function. Functions can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect different points of view, for example, considering the specific application area for which a function can be used (e.g., light, temperature, motion, heat, power, etc.), or the capability that a function can support (e.g., receive, reply, notify, etc.), and so forth.

Label: Gas
Comment: A type of commodity

Label: Gas Consumption
Comment: The amount of gas consumed.

Label: Gateway
Comment: A gateway is a piece of networking hardware used in telecommunications for telecommunications networks that allows data to flow from one discrete network to another.

Label: Generator
Comment: A type of energy-related device that generates energy

Label: GeographicalCoordinatesPoint
Comment:
A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84, includes the latitude, altitude and longitude of a place. Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.

spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT),
  lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).

sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).

Label: Get command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Get current meter value command
Comment: A type of get command

Label: Get meter data command
Comment: A type of get command

Label: Get meter history command
Comment: A type of get command

Label: Get sensing data command
Comment: A type of get command

Label: GlobalHorizontalSolar
Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in horizontal level

Label: GlobalInclined41Solar
Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in angel of 41 degree, the best angel in Madrid

Label: Graph-Based Route
Comment: A graph-based route is a graphical way of representing a route in terms of nodes (sometimes called vertices) and edges (sometimes called arcs).

Label: Greenhouse
Comment: A building, room, or zone, usually chiefly of glass, in which the temperature is maintained within a desired range, used for cultivating tender plants or growing plants out of season.

Label: Grid related
Comment: A category that considers devices based on energy consumption information and profiles to optimize energy efficiency.

Label: Group
Comment: It represents a collection of two or more people who interact with each other and may have the similar characteristics or objectives.

Label: HVACSystem
Comment: The Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) system that provides building indoor comfort

Label: Hall
Comment: A large entrance room of a house or building.

Label: Hall Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a hall.

Label: Hall Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a Hall.

Label: Hall Segment
Comment: A fragment or an atomic element of a hall.

Label: Handheld Device
Comment: A smart device or a computer that is small enough to be used while holding it in the hands.

Label: Hearing Impaired Person
Comment: It is a partial or total unability to hear. It is also known as Hearing loss.

Label: Heat Consumption
Comment: The amount of heat consumed.

Label: Heat Pump
Comment: A heat pump is a device that transfers heat energy from a source of heat to what is called a heat sink.

Label: Heat exchanger
Comment: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers. HeatExchanger is commonly used on water-side distribution systems to recover energy from a liquid to another liquid (typically water-based), whereas AirToAirHeatRecovery is commonly used on air-side distribution systems to recover energy from a gas to a gas (usually air).

Label: Heating Device
Comment: A device that produces heat.

Label: Horizontal Moving Pavement
Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across a horizontal plane over a short to medium distance.

Label: Horizontal Passage
Comment: A type of a passage that connects spatial elements located on the same storey or floor.

Label: Hotel Building
Comment: A building that contains rooms, apartments or suites where people stay for a specific time period.

Label: Humidifier
Comment: A humidifier is a device that adds moisture into the air.

Label: Humidity
Comment: Outdoor humidity

Label: Humidity
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a humidity unit

Label: IT
Comment: An appliance related to IT (Information Technology) such as computer, printer, etc.

Label: Icon
Comment: A small picture or symbol that represents a resource.

Label: Image Description
Comment: A type of description in which images are given to provide information about any entity.

Label: Impact
Comment: An impact is a long-lasting effect of an event (or activity), that continues to exist after the event (or activity) has taken place.

Label: Impaired Person
Comment: An individual whose natural senses or physical abilities are either diminished or damaged.

Label: Incident
Comment: An event or occurance that can be dangerous for the occupants of the building.

Label: Incident Protection Device
Comment: Device that is used to avoid and minimize the effects of potentially danger events for the occupants of the building as well as for the structure of building itself.

Label: IndoorAirQuality
Comment: Indoor air quality describes the quality (or contamination level) of indoor air

Label: IndoorComfort
Comment: Indoor comfort describes the indoor environment

Label: Industrial Building
Comment: Buildings used for industrial production, e.g. factories, workshops, slaughterhouses, breweries, assembly plants, etc.

Label: Instant
Comment: An instant is a time instant

Label: Institutional Building
Comment: Institutions such as hospitals providing medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for ill or injured people.

Label: Intensity
Comment: The measurable amount of a property, such as force, brightness, or a magnetic field (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Interceptor
Comment: An interceptor is a device designed and installed in order to separate and retain deleterious, hazardous or undesirable matter while permitting normal sewage or liquids to discharge into a collection system by gravity.

Label: Interval
Comment: The time interval of the observation or evaluation

Label: Junction
Comment: A logic point that connects more than two corridors.

Label: KPICalculation
Comment: The KPI calculation to calculate specific KPI with mathematical model and datum source

Label: KPICalculationComponent
Comment: The component needed for KPI calculation, like mathematical model, datum source, etc.

Label: KPIEvaluatedObject
Comment: The evaluated object of key performance indicator

Label: KPIValue
Comment: KPI value is the result of KPI calculation

Label: KeyPerformanceIndicator
Comment: Key Performance Indicator that measures the progress towards stakeholder's key performance goal

Label: Kids Area
Comment: A place where infants or young children can play which is surrounded by a boundary normally. It can be both indoor and outdoor.

Label: Kitchen
Comment: Kitchen is a room used mainly for cooking and possibly eating.

Label: Lamp
Comment: A device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something.

Label: Lamp
Comment: A lamp is an artificial light source such as a light bulb or tube.

Label: Laptop
Comment: A computer that is portable and suitable for use while travelling.

Label: Laundry
Comment: A room or zone, as in a home or apartment building, reserved for doing the family wash.

Label: Level control function
Comment: An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of an actuator in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light or set the speed of an electric motor.

Label: Light
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a illuminance unit (lux)

Label: Light switch
Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Lighting, performs the saref:OnOffFunction, measures the property saref:Light, and can be found in the state saref:OnOffState. It can offer a switch on service.

Label: Lighting device
Comment: A device used for illumination, irradiation, signaling, or projection

Label: LightingSystem
Comment: The lighting system in the building

Label: Living Room
Comment: Living Room is the main room of daytime activity.

Label: Load
Comment: A type of energy-related device that consumes energy

Label: Lobby
Comment: An entrance hall, corridor, or vestibule, as in a public building, often serving as an anteroom; foyer.

Label: Location
Comment: A spatial region or named place. It contains the geographical coordinates point or postal address of an object.

Label: Low Stamina Person
Comment: It is the unability to sustain physical or mental activity to a normal level.

Label: Low Vision Person
Comment: A person whose visual acuity is 20/70 or poorer in the better-seeing eye and cannot be corrected or improved with regular eyeglasses.

Label: Mathematical_model
Comment: The mathematical model for KPI calculation. The model is composed of a set of variables and a set of equations that establish relationships between the variables.

Label: Measurement
Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

Label: Measurement
Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

Label: Medical device
Comment: A medical device is attached to a medical piping system and operates upon medical gases to perform a specific function. Medical gases include medical air, medical vacuum, oxygen, carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and nitrous oxide.

Label: Meeting Room
Comment: A type of room designated for social gathering of people, especially professional meetings.

Label: Mental Ability
Comment: The mental ability of an individual to remain focused on an external stimuli or an internal experience for a certain period of time (World Health Organisation).

Label: Mental Impaired Person
Comment: A person having mental impairment in which one's mind is damaged or is not working properly and one have issues such as consciousness, orientation, concentration.

Label: Mercantile Building
Comment: Places where goods are displayed and sold. Examples: grocery stores, department stores, and gas stations.

Label: Meter
Comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being. Further, a device of category saref:Meter that performs a saref:MeteringFunction.

Label: Metering function
Comment: A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand

Label: Micro renewable
Comment: A device that generates renewable energy from natural resources such as teh sun, wind and water

Label: Mild Hearing Impaired Person
Comment: A person who is only able to hear the sounds that are between 25 and 40 dB.

Label: Mobile Phone
Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Mobility Ability
Comment: This ability is used to represent all kinetic abilities a person may have.

Label: Mobility With Assisted Device Person
Comment: A person who used a motorised device for moving, such as motorised wheelchair or scooter, etc.

Label: Mobility With Wheelchair Person
Comment: A person using a wheelchair (a mobility device that is used while having any kind of tempoary or permanent physical impairment).

Label: Moderate Hearing Impaired Person
Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds that are less than 40-75 dB.

Label: Motion
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for motion

Label: Motion State
Comment: It describes the movement of a person.

Label: Motor Impaired Person
Comment: A person who has either partial or total loss of function of a body part, usually a limb or limbs.

Label: Motorised Wheelchair Person
Comment: It is a kind of wheelchair that has either a mechanical engine or an electric battery. It has more speed than a traditional wheelchair.

Label: Movable Device
Comment: A device that can be moved from one place to another place, e.g., mobile phone, computer trolley, etc.

Label: Moving Pavement
Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across a horizontal or inclined plane over a short to medium distance (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Multi level state
Comment: A type of state

Label: Navigation
Comment: The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Navigational Point
Comment: It is a special type of point that connects more than two corridors or enforce change of direction to users or indicate the end of corridors.

Label: Navigational State
Comment: It models the user's navigational state while following the path.

Label: Network Link Strength
Comment: The strength of a network link

Label: Non-Motorised Wheelchair Person
Comment: A traditional wheelchair that is used by hands. It has significantly lower speed than motorised wheelchairs.

Label: Non-Residential Building
Comment: A  non-residential building is a building at least half of which is used for other than residential purposes.

Label: Non-renewableGeneratingUnit
Comment: The generating unit produces energy with non-renewable resources.

Label: Notify command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Observable Property
Comment: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

Label: Observation
Comment:
The observation data of the sensor or meter, the measurement of different parameter
An Observation is a Situation in which a Sensing method has been used to estimate or calculate a value of a Property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to Sensing and Sensor describe what made the Observation and how; links to Property and Feature detail what was sensed; the result is the output of a Sensor; other metadata details times etc.

Label: Observation
Comment: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

Label: ObservationProperty
Comment: The observed property describes what kind of data is observed.

Label: ObservationValue
Comment: The observation result of the sensor or meter

Label: Occupancy
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value (saref:hasValue property) that is measured in a unit of measure for occupancy

Label: Occupancy
Comment: Usage of a space.

Label: OccupancyParameter
Comment: The parameter of occupancy like occupant number or other property

Label: Occupant
Comment: The occupant who occupies the zone in building

Label: OccupantBehavior
Comment: The behavior of occupant that influences to energy demand

Label: OccupantNumber
Comment: The number of occupants in the zone or building

Label: Off command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Off state
Comment: The state of a device that is ON

Label: Office
Comment: A room, set of rooms, or building where the business of a commercial or industrial organization or of a professional person is conducted.

Label: On Off
Comment: A property that determines if something is activated (on) or not (off).

Label: On command
Comment: A type of command

Label: On off function
Comment: An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator

Label: On off state
Comment: A type of state

Label: On state
Comment: The state of a device that is OFF

Label: Open Area Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to an open area.

Label: Open Area Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit from a specifc open space.

Label: Open close function
Comment: An actuating function that allows to open and close a device

Label: Open close state
Comment: A type of state

Label: Open command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Open state
Comment: The state of a device that is OPEN

Label: OperationalKPI
Comment: The operational KPI is the KPI at the operational appliance level, the KPI corresponding to zone and equipment level.

Label: Ordered List
Comment: An ordered list with a given length an indexed items.

Label: Outlet
Comment:
An outlet is a device installed at a point to receive one or more inserted plugs for electrical power or communications.

Power outlets are commonly connected within a junction box; data outlets may be directly connected to a wall. For power outlets sharing the same circuit within a junction box, the ports should indicate the logical wiring relationship to the enclosing junction box, even though they may be physically connected to a cable going to another outlet, switch, or fixture.

Label: PVSystem
Comment: System that generates electricity through solar photovoltaic panel

Label: Panic
Comment: A  sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety among the occupants of the building that often causes wildly unthinking behaviour (Oxford Dictionary of English). In indoor environments, it may happens due to several reasons such as earthquake, fire or other sudden hazardous situations.

Label: Parameter
Comment: A numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation.

Label: Passage
Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent an edge (or an arc) in a route graph.

Label: Passive Fire Protection
Comment: It is an integral component installed in the building while construction to resist the fire.

Label: Pause command
Comment: A type of command

Label: PerformanceGoal
Comment: The performance that needed to be achieved

Label: Person
Comment: It represents a single individual of any age and having any type of characteristics.

Label: Person Ability
Comment: A parameter to express the quality of an ability a specific person (or type of persons) own.

Label: Person Accessibility
Comment: A parameter to express the accessibility of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

Label: Photovoltaic System
Comment: A power system designed to supply usable solar power by means of photovoltaics.

Label: PhotovoltaicGeneratingUnit
Comment: The generating unit produces energy with solar energy, photovoltaic panels.

Label: PhotovoltaicType
Comment: Photovoltaic type describes the type of PV generating unit

Label: Physical object
Comment: Any Object that has a proper space region.  (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

Label: PhysicalObject
Comment: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance. The physical object identified in the district.

Label: Physically Impaired Person
Comment: A physical impairment is a condition in which any part of person's body is either  damaged or is not working properly.

Label: Pipe
Comment: The pipe in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

Label: Point Of Interest
Comment: Any physical or virtual location or object, which may be of interest to a user and may serve as a navigation destination (e.g., room, water dispenser, waiting zone, assembly point, shop, seat, etc).

Label: Point Of Interest Segement
Comment: A traverasal part of a space that is connected to a specific Point of Interest.

Label: Power
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).  Further specializations of the saref:Power class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as PowerMax, PowerMin and PowerExpected are defined.

Label: Power Consumption
Comment: The amount of power consumed.

Label: Power Consumption
Comment: The rate, per unit time, at which energy is consumed.

Label: Power Supply
Comment: Power supplied to a load.

Label: Power unit
Comment: The unit of measure for power

Label: PowerEquipment
Comment: Power equipment is the equipment contained in district power system.

Label: Pressure
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a pressure unit (bar or pascal)

Label: Pressure unit
Comment: The unit of measure for pressure

Label: Price
Comment: A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency

Label: Printer
Comment: A machine that is connected to a computer and prints onto paper using ink.

Label: Profile
Comment: A specification associated to a device to collect information about a certain Property (e.g., Energy) or Commodity (e.g.Water) for optimizing its usage in the home, office or building in which the device is located. This specification is about a certain Property or Commodity (saref:isAbout), can be calculated over a time span (saref:hasTime ) and can be associated to some costs (saref:hasPrice). An example is the Power Profile defined in the SAREF4ENER extension that can be associated to a device for optimizing the Energy efficiency in the home, office or building in which the device is located.

Label: Profound Hearing Impaired Person
Comment: A person who cannot hear sounds softer than 90-120 dB. A person suffering from profound hearing loss, using a hearing aid is also ineffective most of the time.

Label: Property
Comment: Anything that can be sensed, measured or controlled in households, common public buildings or offices. We propose here a list of properties that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: Property
Comment: An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor.

Label: Protective device
Comment:
A protective device breaks an electrical circuit when a stated electric current that passes through it is exceeded.

A protective device provides protection against electrical current only (not as a general protective device). It may be used to represent the complete set of elements including both the tripping unit and the breaking unit that provide the protection. This may be particularly useful at earlier stages of design where the approach to breaking the electrical supply may be determined but the method of tripping may not. Alternatively, this entity may be used to specifically represent the breaking unit alone (in which case the tripping unit will also be specifically identified). This entity is specific to dedicated protective devices and excludes electrical outlets that may have circuit protection.

Label: Protective device tripping unit
Comment: A protective device tripping unit breaks an electrical circuit at a separate breaking unit when a stated electric current that passes through the unit is exceeded.

Label: Pump
Comment: A pump is a device which imparts mechanical work on fluids or slurries to move them through a channel or pipeline. A typical use of a pump is to circulate chilled water or heating hot water in a building services distribution system.

Label: Pump
Comment: The pump in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

Label: Quality
Comment: A degree or grade of excellence or worth.

Label: RSSI
Comment: Received Signal Strength Indicator

Label: Ramp
Comment: A sloping surface joining two different levels, as at the entrance or between floors of a building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: RenewableGeneratingUnit
Comment: The generating unit produces energy with renewable resources.

Label: Residential Building
Comment: A residential building is a building at least half of which is used for residential purposes.

Label: Road
Comment: A road is a way on land between two places that has been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by foot or some form of conveyance, including a motor vehicle, cart, bicycle, or horse.

Label: Role
Comment: The function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Role In Context
Comment: A concept to express that an agent is playing a role in a given context.

Label: Roof
Comment: The roof of the zone

Label: Room
Comment: The room contained in the zone

Label: Room
Comment: A room in a building. This class may be used to group devices.

Label: Room
Comment: A room in a building space enclosed by surfaces, this could also be modelled as role of space, not subclass of the space itself.

Label: Room Entrance
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the entrance to a room.

Label: Room Exit
Comment: A logical point that is used to represent the exit of a room.

Label: Room Segment
Comment: A traversable part in a room that is usually used to go the exit or the other part of the room.

Label: Route
Comment: A set of connected spaces represented by a starting and ending point, that ultimately leads to some specific position or place.

Label: Route Element
Comment: It represents the physical or conceptual elements of a navigation path.

Label: Route Point
Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent a node (or a vertex) in a route graph.

Label: Sanitary terminal
Comment: A sanitary terminal is a fixed appliance or terminal usually supplied with water and used for drinking, cleaning or foul water disposal or that is an item of equipment directly used with such an appliance or terminal.

Label: Schedule
Comment: The day schedule of the event taken place in the zone

Label: Seating Arrangement Route
Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the seat of one or more individuals such as in cinema, stadiums, auditoriums, etc.

Label: Sensing function
Comment: A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy)

Label: Sensor
Comment: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument.

Label: Sensor
Comment:
A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes.
A device that has category saref:Sensor and performs a saref:SensingFunction.

Label: Sensor
Comment: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

Label: Sensor
Comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.

Label: Sensor Ability
Comment: Sensory ability is referred to the brain's ability to receive, interpret, and effectively use the information provided by the senses in human beings such as touch, hear, smell, vision, etc.

Label: Sensor Event
Comment: This concept is used to express an event detected by any sensor.

Label: Sensory Impairmed Person
Comment: Sensory impairment is when one of the senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, taste and spatial awareness, is no longer normal.

Label: Service
Comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service and the function(s) to be represented.

Label: Set absolute level command
Comment: A type of set level command

Label: Set level command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Set relative level command
Comment: A type of set level command

Label: Severe Hearing Impaired Person
Comment: A person who is unable to hear anything without wearing a hearing aid.

Label: Severity
Comment: The quality of being hard to endure, uninviting or formidable.

Label: Shade
Comment: The shade of building envelope

Label: Shading device
Comment: Shading devices are purpose built devices to protect from the sunlight, from natural light, or screening them from view. Shading devices can form part of the facade or can be mounted inside the building, they can be fixed or operable.

Label: Shopping Mall Building
Comment: A set of one or more buildings forming a complex of shops representing merchandisers, with interconnecting walkways enabling visitors to easily walk from unit to unit, along with a parking area.

Label: Shopping Route
Comment: A type of route in which the specific points of interest are mentioned in the form of connected spaces, according to the preferences or interests of a one or more individuals.

Label: Site Of Building
Comment: Building site is a locale containing one or more separate buildings. They are zones.

Label: Slot
Comment: A slot in an ordered list with a fixed index.

Label: Smartphone
Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Smoke
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for smoke

Label: Smoke sensor
Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and saref:EventFunction (which notifies that a certain threshold has been exceeded), and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke.

Label: Social Unit
Comment: An individual, or a group or community, considered as a discrete constituent of a society or larger group (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Solar device
Comment: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.

Label: SolarIrradiance
Comment: The intensity of outdoor solar radiation

Label: Space
Comment: A physical, three dimensional, and one of the most important elements in the design of architecture that can further be divided to create more spaces from it.

Label: Space Saftey
Comment: A parameter to express the safety of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

Label: Space heater
Comment:
Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.

UnitaryEquipment should be used for packaged units supporting a combination of heating, cooling, and/or dehumidification; Coil should be used for coil-based floor heating.

Label: Spatial Ability
Comment: This ability expresses the capacity to understand, reason and remember the spatial relations among objects and spaces.

Label: Stadium Building
Comment: A building that has a large open area surrounded by many rows of seats, and  used for sports events, concerts, etc.

Label: Stairs
Comment: A construction designed to bridge a large vertical distance by dividing it into smaller vertical distances, called steps.

Label: Stakeholder
Comment: The stakeholder in district or building that has performance goals to be achieved

Label: Stampeding
Comment: A sudden and uncontrollable run by the group of people caused by panic.

Label: Start command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Start state
Comment: The state of a device that is STARTED

Label: Start stop function
Comment: An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device

Label: Start stop state
Comment: A type of state

Label: State
Comment: The state in which a device can be found, e.g, ON/OFF/STANDBY, or ONLINE/OFFLINE. We propose here a list of states that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: State of charge
Comment: A property related to measurements of the battery status of a device. Measured in %. 100 % means fully charged. 0 % no charge.

Label: Step down command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Step up command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Stop command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Stop state
Comment: The state of a device that is STOPPED

Label: Storage
Comment: A type of energy-related device that stores energy

Label: Storage Room
Comment: Room for storage.

Label: StoringUnit
Comment: Storing unit is the device that stores energy.

Label: Stove Oven
Comment: A piece of equipment that burns fuel or uses electricity in order to heat a place.

Label: StrategicKPI
Comment: The strategic KPI is the KPI at the strategic decision level, the hyper-aggregated KPI corresponding to district scale

Label: Substation
Comment: Substation is where transform the high/medio voltage power from main grid to low voltage for the energy use of district consumers.

Label: Suite
Comment: A suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartment house (Cambridge English Dictionary). This term is normally used in hotels, resorts, guesthouses, etc.

Label: Swimming Pool
Comment: A tank or large artificial basin, as of concrete, for filling with water for swimming.

Label: Switch
Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction

Label: Switch on service
Comment: A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

Label: Switching device
Comment:
A switch is used in a cable distribution system (electrical circuit) to control or modulate the flow of electricity.

Switches include those used for electrical power, communications, audio-visual, or other distribution system types as determined by the available ports.

Label: TV
Comment: A device shaped like a box with a screen that receives electrical signals and changes them into moving images and sound, or the method or business of sending images and sound by electrical signals.

Label: TacticalKPI
Comment: The tactical KPI is the KPI at tactical decision level, the KPI disaggregated from strategic KPI corresponding to building and system level

Label: Tank
Comment: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.

Label: Task
Comment: The goal for which a device is designed (from a user perspective). For example, a washing machine is designed for the task of washing. We propose here a list of tasks that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: Telephone
Comment: A device for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Temperature
Comment: Outdoor temperature

Label: Temperature
Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a temperature unit (degree_Celsius, degree_Fahrenheit, or degree_kelvin)

Label: Temperature Setpoint
Comment: The target value at which a controller attempts to maintain the temperature.

Label: Temperature sensor
Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature

Label: Temperature unit
Comment: The unit of measure for temperature

Label: TemporalEntity
Comment: A temporal entity is an instant or an interval

Label: Tenant
Comment: A class that describes information about a tenant in a building.

Label: Terrorist Attack
Comment: A surprise event involving the deliberate use of violence against the occupants of the buildings.

Label: Textual Description
Comment: A type of description in which only text or writings are used to provide the information about any entity.

Label: ThermalComfort
Comment: Thermal comfort describes the comfort condition related indoor temperature and humidity

Label: Thermo Solar System
Comment: A power system designed to supply thermal energy by means of solar energy.

Label: Thoroughfare
Comment: A road or path forming a route between two places (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Time
Comment: A saref:Property that allows to specify the time concept in terms of instants or intervals according to the imported W3C Time ontology.

Label: Toggle command
Comment: A type of command

Label: Transformer
Comment:
A transformer is an inductive stationary device that transfers electrical energy from one circuit to another.

Transformer is used to transform electric power; conversion of electric signals for other purposes is handled at other entities: Controller converts arbitrary signals, AudioVisualAppliance converts signals for audio or video streams, and CommunicationsAppliance converts signals for data or other communications usage.

Label: Transition Point
Comment: A point at which person passes from one place to the next.

Label: Transport element
Comment: A transport element is a generalization of all transport related objects that move people, animals or goods within a building or building complex. The TransportElement defines the occurrence of a transport element.

Label: Travel Time
Comment: A parameter to express the time taken (in seconds) by a specific person (or type of persons) to go from one point to another point (i.e., Route Element).

Label: Tree house
Comment: A work or office space set up in a person's home and used exclusively for business on a regular basis.

Label: Tube bundle
Comment: A tube bundle is a device consisting of tubes and bundles of tubes used for heat transfer and contained typically within other energy conversion devices, such as a chiller or coil.

Label: Tumble Dryer
Comment: A machine that dries washed clothes by spinning them in hot air inside a rotating drum.

Label: Turn Point
Comment: A logic point that is used to enforce people to change their direction.

Label: U-value
Comment: Overall thermal conductance of the envelope

Label: Unit of measure
Comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example,  Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.

Label: Unit_of_measure
Comment: The unit of the observation value or KPI calculation value

Label: Unitary control element
Comment:
A unitary control element combines a number of control components into a single product, such as a thermostat or humidistat.

A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location.

Label: UniversalConstant
Comment: The universal constant in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

Label: Utility Room
Comment: Room for other special utilities and hobbies.

Label: VOC
Comment: A property that determines the Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC).

Label: Valve
Comment: A valve is used in a building services piping distribution system to control or modulate the flow of the fluid.

Label: Variable
Comment: The variable in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

Label: Vertical Moving Pavement
Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across an inclined plane over a short to medium distance.

Label: Vertical Passage
Comment: A type of passage that connects spatial elements located on different storey or floor.

Label: Vibration isolator
Comment: A vibration isolator is a device used to minimize the effects of vibration transmissibility in a building.

Label: Visit
Comment: An activity that represents an act of going to see a person or place as a guest, tourist or a spectator. Normally, this type of activity is considered as a leasiure or recreational activity.

Label: Visit Route
Comment: A type of route created for visiting purposes within an indoor environment.

Label: Visiting Group
Comment: A group of two or more people that has the same objective of visiting any space.

Label: VisualComfort
Comment: The visual comfort describes the comfort related to light condition

Label: Visually Impaired Person
Comment: It is a partial or total unability to see. It is also known as visual loss. Here, we considered a person having visual impairment who as severe low vision; 20/200 to 20/400 or higher.

Label: Voltage
Comment: Voltage in Volts

Label: Voltage
Comment: The force of an electric current, measured in volts.

Label: Volume
Comment: A property related to measurements measured in volume. Volume is measured in m³.

Label: Volume
Comment: Specifies the volume of the air conditioned space in building

Label: Waiting Zone
Comment: A space (normally with seating), where people can wait to do some specific activity. During emergency condtions, it is also used for several purposes, such as unification of people with their family members, acquaintances or emergency rescue teams, etc.

Label: Washing Machine
Comment: A home appliance for washing clothes and linens automatically.

Label: Washing machine
Comment: A device of category saref:Appliance and saref:Load that accomplishes the task saref:Washing, performs an actuating function of type saref:StartStopFunction, can be found in the state saref:StartStopState, and can have a saref:Profile that characterizes its energy consumption.

Label: Water
Comment: A type of commodity

Label: Water Consumption
Comment: The amount of water consumed.

Label: Weather
Comment: Weather describes the outdoor environment

Label: Weather Forecasting Service
Comment: Represents a service that provides weather forecast to specific locations.

Label: WeatherCondition
Comment: The weather condition describes the weather such as rain, sun, snow, etc.

Label: WeatherForecast
Comment: The short-term forecast of the weather

Label: WeatherPhenomenon
Comment: Weather phenomenon describes the ourdoor temperature, humidity, solar radiation and wind.

Label: Wind
Comment: The wind condition like wind speed and wind direction

Label: WindDirection
Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind direction

Label: WindGeneratingUnit
Comment: The generating unit produces energy with wind energy, wind turbines.

Label: WindPowerSystem
Comment: System that generates electricity through wind power

Label: WindSpeed
Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind speed

Label: Zone
Comment: The thermal zone in the building
